DOC.brief_summary: The proposed indication for the investigational heat-treated varicella-zoster virus (VZV) vaccine is the prevention of herpes zoster (HZ) and HZ-related complications in immunocompromised individuals.
DOC.brief_title: A Study of an Investigational V212/Heat-Treated VZV Vaccine in Immunocompromised Adults (V212-002)(COMPLETED)
DOC.criteria: Men and women > or = to 18 years of age who are scheduled to receive an autologous or allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplant within 60 days of enrollment HIVinfected patients with a baseline CD4 cell count < or = to 200 cells/mm^3 Patients with hematologic malignancies; or patients who are receiving chemotherapy for breast, colorectal, lung, or ovarian malignancies History of allergy to any vaccine component Prior history of HZ Prior history of receipt of any varicella or zoster vaccine
DOC.keyword: Prevention of herpes zoster and HZ-related complications
